1.title: Acid Arrow
1.target: One nearby or far away creature
1.hit: 4d10 acid damage, and 5 ongoing acid damage.
1.miss: 5 ongoing acid damage, and you regain the spell during your next quick rest.

1.title: Blur
1.effect: For the rest of the battle (or for five minutes), attacks against the target miss 20% of the time.

1.title: Color Spray
1.frequency: Cyclic (cast once per battle OR at-will when the escalation die is even)
1.hit: 2d8 psychic damage, and if the target has 10 hp or fewer after the damage, it is weakened until the end of your next turn.

1.title: Magic Missile
1.target: One nearby or far away enemy.

1.title: Shield
1.action: Free action to cast, when an attack hits your AC.
1.effect: The attacker must reroll the attack. You must accept the new result.

1.title: Shocking Grasp
1.hit: 1d4 lightning damage, and the target pops free from you.
1.miss: You take damage equal to the target's level from botched feedback.

3.title: Confusion
3.target: One nearby enemy with 100 hp or fewer
3.miss: If you miss all targets, you regain this spell during your next quick rest.

3.title: Crescendo
3.target:
One or more enemies engaged with you (but see below)
Special: You can choose more than one target for this spell, but you take a -2 penalty when attacking two targets, a -3 penalty for three targets, and so on.
3.hit: 4d6 thunder damage, and the target pops free from you.

3.title: Force Salvo
3.target: One or more nearby or far away enemies
3.special: The spell creates a number of force bolts equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier. You must target a different creature with each bolt; any extras can't be used.

3.title: Hold Monster
3.target: One nearby enemy with 60 hp or fewer
3.hit: The target cannot move or use move actions (hard save ends, 16+).
3.miss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

3.title: Lightning Bolt
3.target: 1d3 + 1 nearby enemies in a group or in a (rough) line

3.title: Rebuke
3.frequency: Cyclic (once per battle OR at-will when the escalation die is even)
3.target: One nearby enemy with 100 hp or fewer
3.hit: The target is hampered (only makes basic attacks) until the end of your next turn.

3.title: Sleep
3.target: Before making the attack, roll 3d20 + 45 to determine the maximum number of hit points of enemies you can target with the spell. The spell can affect multiple enemies. You must target nearby enemies with the current lowest hit points first, and you don't get to choose the exact targets (except in the case of ties). If adding a creature would exceed the spell's hit point maximum, that enemy can't be a target.
3.hit: The target falls unconscious (hard save ends, 16+; it also ends if the target takes 10+ damage).
3.miss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

3.title: Teleport Shield
3.special: For the rest of the battle, once per round when an enemy moves to engage you, you can make the following attack against it as a free action before it has the chance to attack in melee.
3.hit: Teleport the enemy somewhere nearby you can see. You can place them in combat with one of your allies, but you can't place them in a dangerous location (lava pit or mid-air or other cheesy tricks; it's a defensive teleport rather than the perfect offensive tool).

5.title: Denial
5.hit: 9d10 psychic damage, and the target is hampered until the end of your next turn.

5.title: Dimension Door
5.effect: You teleport somewhere nearby that you can see.

5.title: Fireball
5.target: 1d3 nearby enemies in a group. If you cast recklessly, you can target 1d3 additional enemies, but then your allies engaged with any of the targets may also take damage (see below).
5.special: When you cast this spell, you can choose to cast it recklessly.
5.miss:
Half damage.
Reckless miss: Your allies engaged with the target take one-fourth damage.

5.title: Invisibility
5.effect: Until the end of the battle (or for five minutes out of combat), the target becomes invisible until it attacks or uses some ridiculously flashy action.

7.title: Blink
7.effect:
For the rest of the battle (or for five minutes), the target gains resist damage 16+. Enemies who can see invisible creatures ignore this resistance.
Whenever the target uses a move action, there is a 50% chance that it can teleport somewhere nearby instead of physically moving.

7.title: Flight
7.effect: The target can fly until the end of the battle (or for five minutes). Your speed doesn't increase appreciably but you can move in three-dimensions.

7.title: Haste
7.effect:
On the target's next turn (not this one, if you cast it on yourself), the target gains an additional standard action.
In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns this battle, if the escalation die is even, roll a d20 and add the escalation die; on a 16+, the target gains an additional standard action that turn.

7.title: Invisibility Purge
7.target: Any nearby enemies who are invisible, whether you know they are there or not
7.attack: Charisma + Level vs. MD, rolled by GM
7.hit: The target turns visible and cannot become invisible again this battle.
7.miss: If there are one or more invisible creatures nearby, you become aware of their presence. Not where they are, or who they are, but that there are invisible creatures present.

7.title: Overcome Resistance
7.target: 1d3 nearby allies (you can count yourself as an ally)
7.effect: Until the end of the battle, the target ignores the resistance power of any creature it targets with an attack.

7.title: Transfer Enchantment
7.special: You or an ally you are next to must be suffering from a condition caused by an enemy for you to cast this spell.
7.hit: 2d6 x 10 psychic damage, and you can transfer one condition caused by your enemies from you or the ally you are next to over to the target. If timing is required, interpret the transferred condition as if you had caused it with this spell.

9.title: Disintegrate
9.hit:
4d8 x 10 damage, and the target is vulnerable (hard save ends, 16+).
In addition, if the target drops to 0 hp from this attack, or drops to 0 hp before it saves against the vulnerable effect of this attack, it is gone, dusted, nothing remaining.

9.title: Meteor Swarm
9.target: You can make an attack with each meteor against 1d4 enemies in a group. (It works best against enemies who are unable to spread out and are forced to stand and be swarmed.) Alternatively, use the spell to level an area with high impact property damage.
9.special:
You summon a meteor swarm. If you're underground, you get the ur-dark stalactite equivalent! Nothing more happens this round, but roll 1d3 + 1 to determine how many meteors you have summoned.
At the start of your next turn, even if you are unconscious or dead or have left the area, the meteors arrive one per turn at the start of each of your turns and slam into the combat area.
9.hit:
4d4 x 10 damage of the energy type of your choice (cold, fire, lightning).
Any allies engaged with the enemies you are targeting take one-fourth damage from each meteor that impacts the area.

9.title: Teleport
9.effect:
You and up to 4 allies next to you can teleport to any location in the world, underworld, or overworld that you have previously visited.
When you teleport, roll a d20. If you roll a 1, something weird happened and the GM is going to send you somewhere else interesting. Otherwise, you and your allies arrive at the desired location at the start of your next turn.
Any effects of spells or items cast before teleporting are dispelled and no longer function on arrival, so it's best to wait and use such spells after you arrive.
